detectors.description:
SafeERC20.safeTransfer(Token,address,uint256) (../../../Desktop/SmarthER/mainnet/d5/d5eab5726bcd05a62becc74bdac5df9c7fa93622_Sellix.sol#79-91) uses a dangerous strict equality:
	- prevBalance - _value == _token.balanceOf(address(this)) (../../../Desktop/SmarthER/mainnet/d5/d5eab5726bcd05a62becc74bdac5df9c7fa93622_Sellix.sol#90)

Sellix.withdrawEth(address,uint256).addr (../../../Desktop/SmarthER/mainnet/d5/d5eab5726bcd05a62becc74bdac5df9c7fa93622_Sellix.sol#129) lacks a zero-check on :
		- addr.transfer(amount * 1) (../../../Desktop/SmarthER/mainnet/d5/d5eab5726bcd05a62becc74bdac5df9c7fa93622_Sellix.sol#130)

Sellix.multiPayoutEth(address[],uint256[]) (../../../Desktop/SmarthER/mainnet/d5/d5eab5726bcd05a62becc74bdac5df9c7fa93622_Sellix.sol#156-172) has external calls inside a loop: addresses[j].transfer(amounts[j] * 1) (../../../Desktop/SmarthER/mainnet/d5/d5eab5726bcd05a62becc74bdac5df9c7fa93622_Sellix.sol#168)
